website_summaries.verdict: Strong type of wheel paint that will stand up to harsh conditions without losing integrity.
pros: Available in a few different finishes that you'll like
Dries faster than some other options so you can finish the job more quickly
Resists common problems in this area of the vehicle from brake dust or heat
Works on steel or aluminum wheels and plastic hubcaps
cons: Needs a clear coat over the top of it to work at optimum level

customer_reviews.title: No problems with proper prep work
customer_reviews.text: The imperfections in the set of wheels I did were entirely from user error. - Prepped by stripping to bare metal (aluminum wheels) - Applied 2 coats etching primer (Rustoleum) - Applied 2 coats filler primer (Rustoleum) - Applied 2 coats color (should have done 3 light coats since I ended up with some runs) - Applied 3 coats clear coat (duplicolor)
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: It's lighter than I wanted, but a light coat of lens tint with it works great!
customer_reviews.text: Decided to paint my wheels a dark bronze and this seemed to be the best option. First time around, I did a few coats and it ended up too light. Added a light coat of lens tint and got the prefect color. The next time, I just did a single, moderate coat on my black wheels and got the same color I liked. Paint is easy to use and didn't run for me at all. I was impressed by the color, ease of application and how quickly it dries.
customer_reviews.author: Paul H.

customer_reviews.title: Semi-Pro
customer_reviews.text: If you are a car aficionado and really enjoy tricking up your machine, Dupli-color probably isn’t for you. But if you want to spend a few bucks rather than a few thousand on new wheels for your average car, this works GREAT! The rims of our 2005 Celica GT were looking pretty shabby —flaky paint, greasy spots and stains — but we wire brushed and sanded off the loose paint, washed them thoroughly, and sprayed this on — without removing them from the vehicle. It was an easy job and the wheels look factory-fantatstic! (A suggestion — you might want to cut out a simple round template to cover the tires while you spray.)
customer_reviews.author: CSharms

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bronze color - looks perfect! Extremely satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: This paint looked amazing on my wheels. I recommend entirely! For a set of 17" wheels I used every bit of 4 cans. We did one solid coat on the inside and many coats on the outside / top of the wheels. The end result is amazing! Used in combination with 4 cans of filler primer and 2 cans of VHT matte clear coat.
customer_reviews.author: wdritchey

customer_reviews.title: Hard to control spray area...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what the positive reviews were about but I had some localized scuffs and scratches after hitting a curb. I blocked out all irrelevant areas and the spray mist area is too big for smaller areas. And it comes out too wet and drips down all over the rim , uneven, with bubbling and dark flecks. The color looks like it matches my BMW but it looks horrible and uneven and I think is not viscous enough (the rim is vertical and this stuff doesn't stay put). I probably made this worse and now have to find someone to do it professionally.
customer_reviews.author: category III

customer_reviews.title: Put in the work for prep and it will show 💯
customer_reviews.text: The paint on my G35 wheels (19" Rays) was coming off, so I thought to fix them as they go for around $1000 a set of 4 refurbished like new. I couldn't be happier with the outcome, they look amazing and I spent about $80. Prep work is KEY to painting wheels, no cutting corners. I recommend Bondo filler & primer and VHT clear coat. I put 9 coats in total 3 of Filler & primer, 3 of Duplicolor Bronze, and 3 of VHT Clearcoat Matte finish. Can't wait to paint them another color someday.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Bautista

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy with the results. It took a nasty set of Miata wheels and made them look like new!
customer_reviews.text: I used this Bronze wheel paint to refinish a set of 15x6" 1999 Miata wheels. See the pics for the end result. I think they look great. The prep work is key and I sanded and cleaned them well and prepped with etching primer, then bronze top coat, then wheel clear coat. I used one can for 4 wheels, but I only painted the exterior, not the interior. I would recommend having any exterior weights removed prior to painting. You can get them rebalanced with stick on interior wheels for a cleaner look. All in all I'm very happy with the results. It took a nasty set of corroded wheels and made them look like new.
customer_reviews.author: Clay McLendon

customer_reviews.title: I sanded down the faces of the wheels as best I could to get rid of the pitting
customer_reviews.text: I have an old set of 17" wheels for my Bimmer with snow tires mounted on. Last years New England winter absolutely killed them. The salt and chemicals left them pitted. I sanded down the faces of the wheels as best I could to get rid of the pitting. I then masked off and applied a full can of VHT prime coat followed by two cans of this bronze. Lastly I sprayed a full can of clear over them and I am fully satisfied with the result. You will definitely need at least 2 cans to do 4 wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: MUST BUY !!
customer_reviews.text: Your buggin if you don’t like this product rims look beautiful looks like brand new black rims that I put on I order 3 cans I had one left over. I absolutely love love love and I willll be ordering again everyone is like omg how did do that I’m a female and I did it by myself it’s so easy to apply!! Definitely a must have if you want your rims colored.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My go-to satin black for my vehicles
customer_reviews.text: I use this paint on several surfaces on my vehicles. Primary use is on wheels where it lays down nice and seems to be plenty durable. The fan nozzle is really forgiving and delivers a nice even spray. You just have to move a bit slower than your regular rattle can. For my steel wheels I do one coat of Rustoleum rust converter as a primer, then a thin coat of the Dupli-Color. Then a second heavy coat of the Dupli-Color to achieve the finish I want. Very tunable. Put it on heavy and you can get a near gloss satin. Go a bit dryer by holding the can further away and you can get a less shiny result.
customer_reviews.author: MWH

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Painted my Harley rims and they came out GREAT! Very happy
customer_reviews.author: C74740

customer_reviews.title: Works Well!
customer_reviews.text: My son's first car is a Honda Accord, and he wanted to jazz it up a bit by upgrading the wheels. Well as a college student buying a set of rims for a 12 year old car is not a wise investment and not really affordable. But hey a few cans of paint are! After sanding, and priming he added the top coat with this paint and its been almost a year and its held up great!
customer_reviews.author: JoeO

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money...
customer_reviews.text: Please - save yourself some time. Don't purchase. Keep moving along. These aren't the cans of paint you are looking for. To state that I am absolutely frustrated with wasting my money is an understatement. After shaking for nearly 30 minutes, I got runny clear and silver sparkles. BOTH CANS! And you can't return these items. I would have been better going to the Dollar General store and buying the $2 spray paint than dealing with this mess.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Faith

customer_reviews.title: Actually this paint is really good for wheels.
customer_reviews.text: I've had mixed luck with Duplicolor products. Some are good, some are really bad. This HWP102 Graphite Wheel coating is one of the good products. It sprays really well and covers way better than I expected. So far I have painted two wheels with only one can of HWP102. I put on 2 light coats which covered really well then the next day I put two more light coats and wheels look great. The paint works well, it dries quickly and I had no runs at all.
customer_reviews.author: S. A. ROBBINS

customer_reviews.title: Good coverage.
customer_reviews.text: I used this paint on 4 wheels. The can was enough to apply two coats on each wheel and I had a bit left over. It covered well and did not run. You have to apply it thick and carefully on the 2nd or 3rd coat so that you get a good gloss. If you don't go thick enough with your last coat it won't level out by itself.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Does a beautiful job for spray paint
customer_reviews.text: For just spray paint, this stuff worked fantastic. I put quite a bit of time into it, and that probably helped the outcome. I started by dismounting all the tires and sandblasting all four rims. I then put on three coats of duplicolor self etching primer, waited overnight and hit it with 4 coats of black duplicolor paint and 3 coats of clear coat gloss. Waited for them to cure for a few days, mounted them and they looked beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not consistent.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it was my specific bottle, but it sprayed messy and had drip marks. Not consistent. I shook for 3 minutes, and even had it sitting in warm water for 5 minutes before. Very disappointed, have to redo my rims now smfh.
customer_reviews.author: Giorgio

customer_reviews.title: So disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I spent hours sanding and cleaning my Honda wheel covers In preparation for this paint. I followed the instructions precisely, and the paint came out in uneven splatters when I started using it. I had to wipe the nozzle clear every few seconds. It does not produce a smooth finish whatsoever - more like splatter paint. It was too late to turn back, and I guess the shoddy paint job looks slightly better than the peeling finish I had before. So, so disappointing due to the time I invested in this project.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Paint is soft, I can dig into it with my nails.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to apply, looks great, but the paint is soft as dog poop. Following all of the prep steps and after letting it cure for two weeks I can still dig into it with my nails. I wish i spent more money on a better paint, and honestly would like a refund considering that it's not as hard as they adversitise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Turns Yellow when used in exterior environments.
customer_reviews.text: I used Dupli-Color clear coat once I re-sprayed my BMW BBS wheels with Wurth silver spray paint. Within a month, the clear coat turned yellow and I needed to sand my wheel back to primer and repaint with no clear coat. After 4 months, the wheels still look great. Don’t buy this paint if for automotive purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J in FL

customer_reviews.title: Good color - even coating
customer_reviews.text: You can cover a lot of area. Prep your material with only the best products, and use a series of VERY LIGHT layers. Paint dries rather quickly in between coats, but will take a few hours to fully cover with layers, and a day or two to fully cure. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Devil Dave & Allie

customer_reviews.title: adds new life to tired wheeels
customer_reviews.text: goes on evenly, if you take your time it won't run. Afterwards the wheels come out looking great. I used steel wool to rough up the wheels, wiped them down with alcohol, & taped off the tires. The final result looks better than I had hoped for.
customer_reviews.author: J. S. Ragman

customer_reviews.title: works well, one had a bad nozzle, great color.
customer_reviews.text: they no longer carry gold at my local auto parts store so, used 2 cans for all 4 wheels, I did sand the original finish off, not completely but at least get the first layer of stuff off, then 2 coats of primer, then wet sand again, then this wheel paint, I'll see how long it will last. Note you can't really see any gold flakes etc, is a nice shade of gold, you don't need clear coat if you like the semi gloss look. yea did this for my black WRX, looks pretty cool. one of the valve did start to drip, so I swapped it and it worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: pt00323i

customer_reviews.title: Awesome look!
customer_reviews.text: Nice coverage. Follow can directions and you can't go wrong. Get the rim prepped well. My first wheel had fish eyes had to wet sand and repaint. Used clear after 3 coats. 2 clear coats
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Worsley

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the primer along with the paint to spruce up my hubcaps without having to purchase new ones. The paint works wonder and gave my car that fresh new feeling I was looking for. Just follow the directions and you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: S.L.T Review

customer_reviews.title: Great for painting rims
customer_reviews.text: If rims are properly sanded this will stick great and rarely chip. I had to do one touch up since I painted my rims two years ago. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Efrain Rox

customer_reviews.title: Would order again
customer_reviews.text: Product worked great. I didn’t have to deal with the condescending Amazon Customer “Service” supervisors like I did for another item. Amazon Customer Service used to be AMAZING, now they essentially do not care what the buyer says. I would order this again.
customer_reviews.author: Zack D

customer_reviews.title: A pretty good match for the "Matte Graphite" colored wheels that ...
customer_reviews.text: A pretty good match for the "Matte Graphite" colored wheels that I have. You can see a bit of difference under certain light conditions, but you'll have to really really look for it. So for touch-up jobs, or if you are respraying the whole wheel, it's a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: GreenBanana

customer_reviews.title: Cheap fix for new wheels
customer_reviews.text: I was going to attempt to remove the clear coat and refinish my polished alloy wheels. Due to my lack of skill, I ended up scratching my wheels and this was plan B. Paint looks great and has held up well thus far. Covered with a clear coat after numerous coats were applied per directions.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: the spray it uneven
customer_reviews.text: since it has metallic color to it, the paint looks uneven, even when i shake very well, it comes out not what i expected, the paint it not smooth and it has metal spot to it, i noticed that is has to do with the spray head on the can.
customer_reviews.author: Chang

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: I used this to touch up my rims but actually started to use it to put a coat on my tire to make them look new and it would make my tires look brand new. Always getting the question “did you get new tires?” And no I didn’t so I would say yes this a great guy because you can make your tires and rims look brand new!
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a great spray paint.
customer_reviews.text: This paint is great. Great coverage, zero fisheye, good gloss, great touch up after finish got damaged. I painted the outside of 3 steel wheels with one can so 2 cans will easily paint 4+. This is so much better than the "other" brand. Glad I found it.
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: New painted rims.
customer_reviews.text: Good product and great results on car rims. Warning, apply slowly to avoid running.
customer_reviews.author: private

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to shake bottle well
customer_reviews.text: Like rest of comments the sprayer could use some work. Also it. Darken up a lot more then i thought. First couple of coats were good then it could have been the clearcoat but at first it was perfect and about a week later it really darken up to a tan color.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a clean look
customer_reviews.text: Only needed 2 cans for all four 18s for a basic full coat. But I used a 3rd one just for a little razzle dazzle to hold up longer. Only took a couple hours and it was done. Dries really fast.
customer_reviews.author: Raul Morales

customer_reviews.title: Not good after car wash.
customer_reviews.text: I used to paint my car wheels and the come out very nice. I'll recommend. Update August 2019: I down grade to one star because I had my car washed by the dealer and the wheels are very bad. Same dealer washed my car multiple times before to paint them. I had the wheels plastidiped and still nothing wrong with them after the dealer wash them.
customer_reviews.author: Bogdan M

customer_reviews.text: Only needed two cans to do both my 15inch rims on my 05 Dakota. Look very nice as well. I did have a problem with one of the cans it's like something was stuck inside the stem so I had to clean it out and it worked fine! And believe it or not I have a flatbed and I used a half a can on my bed and it looks amazing! My bed is made out of aluminum
customer_reviews.author: DJ T

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! No streaks and super easy to apply, just don’t go too heavy with the coating or it will drip and dry with unevenness.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: OEM quality
customer_reviews.text: Amazing quality, painted rims first time. Recommend to keep cans in very warm water like 10-20 minutes
customer_reviews.author: 3ABXO3

customer_reviews.title: could of been better if i had a garage ,i did it on a parking rushing.
customer_reviews.text: exactly what i needed.even when i have one wheel that is still not looking good because i didn't do it well.
customer_reviews.author: Gosty jose

customer_reviews.title: Worst paint ever
customer_reviews.text: Worst spray paint I've ever used. Bought 2 cans, first can would spray in huge bursts randomly. Second can nozzle leaked. I'll never buy duplicolor again.
customer_reviews.author: Hawkzilla

customer_reviews.title: Nice!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m really surprised how well it went on, looks and lasted the winter. I did my winter wheels (factory) and the only problem I had was a bad stem and the had to balance the wheel again and they scratched it. Quick fix though.
customer_reviews.author: TOP DOG

customer_reviews.title: Take Your Time and It Will Show
customer_reviews.text: Felt like it would start splattering (as opposed to spraying) when it started getting low. Either way take your time and prep properly.
customer_reviews.author: ackerman77

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with DupliColor
customer_reviews.text: I been buying this product for a while now and always have been black or metallic grey. This time I wanted something different and here it goes!
customer_reviews.author: Georvanovic

customer_reviews.title: Quality control people!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 cans to paint my rims. Got thru one can and picked up the 2nd can gave it a good shake and sprayed(I did test spray but was in the air and didn’t notice anything different. Went to rim and gave it a spray and boom big bolts of paint on my almost finished rim. I had to re sand that entire rim. The can didn’t have the red nozzle installed. In all my years I’ve never had that problem. I will look from now on. The can on right
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Easy to spray and beautiful color
customer_reviews.text: Loved the outcome on my Lexus wheels. Its so easy to spray with the nozzle and paint spreads evenly. This is both for the pro n novice. The bronze is a bit darker when it dries up but not complaining. I loved the outcome
customer_reviews.author: bernard kamau

customer_reviews.title: Awesome rattle can wheel paint
customer_reviews.text: Use these on wheels with 2k clearcoat and I have fooled people consistently that they were not powder coated or professionally painted.
customer_reviews.author: G. Stone II

customer_reviews.title: quality
customer_reviews.text: This product when applied properly will leave a professional finish and is absolutely stunning. I used the silver paint on the wheels of my high end show car and am completely blown away by the quality finish. Keep in mind that I am a car builder and have top notch paint skills. Also the paint is very workable as far as polishing with compound and waxes. Seller went above and beyond to satisfy buyer when product was damaged during shipping.
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey varga

customer_reviews.title: IT'S A MIRACLE!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My rims went from rusted to looking new. I did 3 coats evenly. Its my first time and now i think i will do the other 3 rims.
customer_reviews.author: NWOO

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Good product. I wanted chrome. I didn’t want to send back the product, so I found a purpose for them. One can (I bought two) did all four rims.
customer_reviews.author: Shaborn

customer_reviews.title: Paint is paint, this stuff is good
customer_reviews.text: Color match is exactly what I was looking for. If you scratch your rims, this is perfect for covering up the damage.
customer_reviews.author: Jay S

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Worked great, i'd recommend at least 1 can per wheel, depending on size and amount of clear you add, it'll use all of them. I ended up needing more as the metallic base i used was rougher (6 cans)
customer_reviews.author: Justin Rohr

customer_reviews.title: Quick cheap fix
customer_reviews.text: Rims were all scratched and chipped from the years, didn’t want to spend the money on new ones since I’m getting a new car next year. This worked great for freshening them up a bit. Used clear coat after two coats of the charcoal color. Good enough!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great paint
customer_reviews.text: Repainted wheels on my SUV. Does a really nice job. Wheels look brand new. 1 can did 3, 20 inch wheels with 3 coats.
customer_reviews.author: Ted B

customer_reviews.title: Awesome color
customer_reviews.text: Painted my rims black. My car is a shade a brown, and this paint is really close to the car color. I used this for a metallic touch. Turned out way better than anticipated. Just a touch of color on top of the black
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Good coverage
customer_reviews.text: Covers great. Looks good. Hopefully holds up but three weeks later it’s looking good.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Quality bronze wheel paint.
customer_reviews.text: I followed the directions on the can and used this product with duplicolor sandable primer and wheel clear coat, the finish came out really nice and I was able to get this done in about 6 hours. There is a little bit of flake in the paint I wasn’t expecting but it looks nice. Would highly recommend this product and will use again.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob C.

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: works well on my rims and so far hasn't been coming off easily as long you put multiple overlaping coats on it
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Super Shine
customer_reviews.text: Great product to keep my outdoor metal art free from rust. Arrived swiftly. Unavailable oroduct in my area.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Ehlinger

customer_reviews.title: Buy glossier paint
customer_reviews.text: Worked pretty good but was more of a matte finish than gloss had to go over it with other gloss paint. Haven’t ran yet so not sure how durable paint is
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Two cans with no pressure
customer_reviews.text: I bought the six pack of clear and so far two out of four that I have went to use had no pressure and barely dribbled out any clear coat. They were useless and had to get thrown away.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Good product, worked well.
customer_reviews.text: Almost got heat exhaustion, the instructions said put on 2 coats and it was in mid August!
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Stephan

customer_reviews.title: Looks a lot better.
customer_reviews.text: Really like this coating for my old original painted wheels on mighty max. Like all painting, 95% is in the prep, used wire wheel and wiped with denatured before taping out and spraying, holding up well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great OEM Replacement Wheel paint for my Honda ATC200E 1983
customer_reviews.text: Great OEM Replacement Wheel paint for my Honda ATC200E 1983
customer_reviews.author: Eric Neusiis

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper at auto store.
customer_reviews.text: Not cheap. Found it for less at Autozone but it was an easy order.
customer_reviews.author: F. Dean

customer_reviews.title: Looks like just black paint
customer_reviews.text: Goes on thin, and is flaking off now. Coated some stainless bolt heads on wheels, cleaned and scrubbed bolts with solvent first. just did not stick.
customer_reviews.author: Brian L.

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Great product used it to spray my stellies and they look great
customer_reviews.author: DNG 210

customer_reviews.title: Great Wheel Paint!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product. Levels out perfectly. Would buy again as needed!
customer_reviews.author: Trob

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: My wheels came out looking real good. Prepping the wheels takes the longest time. I used scotch brite pads to take the old clearcoat off. First picture shows two light coats followed by one wet medium coat as instructed on the can. I also used the Dupli-Color wheel gloss (2 light, 1 wet) to finish it off in the second picture.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Kogot

customer_reviews.title: Sprayed on nice and even
customer_reviews.text: Sprayed on nice and even. Finish seems durable and will know with time. Bad thing is that when the can gets to about 30% full, and I guess pressure in the can drops, it starts spitting paint. I tried three cans and they all did this. Lucky I had bought four cans so I had plenty extra. I would recommend one per wheel so you can avoid this problem.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for nephew spray Blacking out his car/ chrome
customer_reviews.author: Sara Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Lots of silver flake
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a very light metallic silver, this ain't it. It's an excellent product, but it has a lot of flake in it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Good paint.
customer_reviews.text: Looks really good. Be careful not to spray your roaters, or your brakes will make a terrible sound. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Julie Ross

customer_reviews.title: Working as indicated
customer_reviews.text: Covered/hid some scratches of an Infiniti QX 70 rim leaving it looking like new
customer_reviews.author: Celestron

customer_reviews.title: My wheels look like factory.
customer_reviews.text: Best spray paint I have eved used. My wheels look like factory.
customer_reviews.author: Big Daddy O

customer_reviews.title: Nice look
customer_reviews.text: Great finish. I recommend priming if you are painting over metal. Also recommend 4K clear over the top.
customer_reviews.author: btsfire

customer_reviews.title: Good paint
customer_reviews.text: Not as dark as I hoped. No flake at all.
customer_reviews.author: D.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap alternative to powder coating
customer_reviews.text: Used it on my commuters rims, didn’t chip till after two year and not much.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Palacios

customer_reviews.title: Satin black
customer_reviews.text: I liked the look on the satin black spray paint it looks very nice and gives the wheels a new pop
customer_reviews.author: Ackeem Rhooms

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on new steel wheels
customer_reviews.text: Gave my new $40 Black Trail Master wheels a great new look. People are surprised the finish is as good as it is applied with a spray can. The nozzle works good unlike cheaper brands of paint
customer_reviews.author: Tony S

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last, even when properly applied and sealed
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't last, even when properly applied and sealed. Will start chipping and peeling in 4-6months. I thought you might be able to get a year with a careful application (6 coats paint and 4 clear sealer), but, its already falling away after ~6 mo.
customer_reviews.author: K. Shockey

customer_reviews.title: Protect your outdoor decorations!
customer_reviews.text: Suggested for protecting outdoor decorations. Dries fast and clear, adds shine and makes colors pop! Use it for all of my outdoor metal and wood sculptures.
customer_reviews.author: sunshinendaisies

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. But twice what you think you'll need!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome paint. Super hard, good coverage. But twice what you think you need so you can get a good number of coats on.
customer_reviews.author: GerryFord

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Came out great. Like the color. Needed only 2 cans to paint 4 wheels
customer_reviews.author: Gee

customer_reviews.title: NOT WHAT IT SAYS IT IS
customer_reviews.text: They claim it creates a high gloss, silver finish and all it is is some mediocre GRAY, dull paint which YOU CANNOT RETURN! What a sham. Stay Away!
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Paint dries to a very durable finish
customer_reviews.text: This made my rims look expensive. Very easy to use as long as you prep your rims properly
customer_reviews.author: Kemo Enriquez

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great for a quick rim rash cover up. Once dried it looks nearly as good. From 5ft+ you can’t even tell the difference. Well worth the price if you just need to patch up some curb rash scrapes on your black rims.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Murray

customer_reviews.title: 3 cans = 4 17" wheels
customer_reviews.text: Painted my rashed up wheels (after much filling and sanding). Got two cans for four wheels, and should have got three. Two worked but three would have made me more comfortable. The only advice I can give is make sure your prep work is longer than the actual painting. If so you did it right. Looks superb and when I feel like a new color I will be doing it again.
customer_reviews.author: CSoAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: Had some scratches on my wheel. Used this and covers up the crack perfectly and dry fast
customer_reviews.author: HarSir

customer_reviews.title: Probably will not buy again but in the end it did look good
customer_reviews.text: Paint is thin have to apply to many coats but looks good

customer_reviews.text: Very good, I used this to paint my bumper end caps on my atv, looks professionally done, I also used the clear coat and the prime

customer_reviews.text: Good paint , dries fast in the right temp .

customer_reviews.text: Painted my chrome kx65 wheels black came out great and so far has held up pretty well

customer_reviews.title: I used this stuff to paint a chain guard on ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this stuff to paint a chain guard on my Triumph motorcycle. It's tough as nails, resists peeling and flaking, and sprays well.What ,ore do you need?
customer_reviews.author: dp3352

customer_reviews.title: this is the best paint I have found that can be had at ...
customer_reviews.text: Lets not shake it any other way, its rattle can. That said, this is the best paint I have found that can be had at just about every local auto parts store. I recently refinished a set of wheels, stripping them down and building up. Self etching, gray filler, black inside, bronze on face, and clear on face to finish. As with any rattle can, watch for over spray. The paint tends to dry quickly, spray fine, and can powder over your nice finish easily if not careful. Make sure to read the instructions carefully on each different can, and follow them. Very happy with the end result,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I just put this on my wheels the other day. So far it seems pretty good and it looks great, came out glossy just like the product shows.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for my Corvette wheels
customer_reviews.text: I was worried it would look cheap but I hated the look of road rash in my corvette wheels. After sanding the scratches down and cleaning and 2 coats of this paint you cannot see it any more
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Gallardo

customer_reviews.title: Great Color!
customer_reviews.text: Really good bronze color! It has a good spray and it works great for hydrodipoing as well! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PAINT!
customer_reviews.text: This paint sprayed on super smooth and clean. I used it on a motorcycle gas tank though, apparently that was a bad idea. A couple drops of gas ruined all of my hard work. I take full responsibility of my mistake and I'm hoping no one else has to.
customer_reviews.author: Zac Finley

customer_reviews.title: Faulty spray top
customer_reviews.text: Upon first spray, I found out the hard way it had a faulty spray top and it spewed black paint all over my hands. I’m going on several days with faded black paint covering my hands. Had to order a second bottle, which worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Blanchat

product_meta.title: Dupli-Color EHWP10107 Silver High Performance Wheel Paint - 12 oz.
product_meta.description: Color:Silver| Size:SingleDupli Colors high performance wheel coating will customize or dress up worn out wheels. It's the spray-on solution that creates a custom look. The advanced, track tested acrylic enamel formula restores original wheel appearance and protects wheels. It resists brake dust, chemicals, cleaning solvents, heat and chipping. Ideal for use on steel or aluminum wheels and plastic wheel coverings. Top with clear coat HWP 103 Clear for optimal durability and gloss.
